target="_blank">learning </a>programmes to its corporate strategy.</p><p id="6228" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">To successfully institute a corporate academy which is focused on <a class="ag nm" href="https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">learning </a>and helps to build and enhance employee skills such as innovation, creativity, leadership, problem solving and practical business knowledge among others, organisations must take the following into consideration:</p><p id="d694" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">· <strong class="mq gx">Demonstrate the role of the Academy:</strong> The drivers of the <a class="ag nm" href="https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">learning </a>institute within the organisation must ensure that they adequately educate other members of staff on how the corporate academy will add value to the organisation. This will include the rationale behind the academy, how it will serve as a knowledge centre for employees and a catalyst for organisational growth.</p><p id="16b4" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">· <strong class="mq gx">Align the academy with organisational goals:</strong> the academy is not just a place of <a class="ag nm" href="https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">learning </a>within the organisation. It is a place of <a class="ag nm" href="https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">learning </a>that supports and contributes to the achievement of the strategic goals of the organisation.</p><p id="1f98" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">· <strong class="mq gx">Institute proper oversight:</strong> A decision must be taken on whether the corporate academy falls within the purview of HR, the COO, the <a class="ag nm" href="https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/" rel="noopener ugc nofollow" target="_blank">learning and development</a> manager or any other senior manager. What is most important is that a senior member of staff must be saddled with the responsibility of ensuring that the academy plays its role adequately.</p><p id="e8eb" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">· <strong class="mq gx">Create a vision:</strong> As an organisation, you must have an idea of what your corporate academy will achieve in the next couple of years. Define the short-term goals and long term goals of the academy and develop internal communication to keep staff in the loop regarding its awareness and implementation.</p><p id="4813" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">· <strong class="mq gx">Determine the operating principles:</strong> What are the core values and guiding principles that will determine how you run your academy? These values must align with your organisation’s core values.</p><p id="e96e" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mo mp gw mq b mr ms mt mu mv mw mx my mz na nb nc nd ne nf ng nh ni nj nk nl gp bk">In all, a corporate academy must address the business and talent challenges an organisation is faced with. How to Successfully Implement a Corporate Academy in Your Organisation
The tripartite concepts of [Training](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/), [Learning and Development](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/) have become increasingly important in modern day corporate bodies.
Beyond the more specific [training](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/) programmes employees are made to undergo, there’s the need for a more holistic and strategic [learning and development](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/) function.
It is, therefore, no surprise that more and more organisations are beginning to realise the importance of having their own corporate academy.
Corporate academies drive the educational goals of organisations who are keen on improving their [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)culture. The idea is to have a classroom-style hub which serves as the organisations’ specific and recognised [training ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)ground in a bid to align the professional growth of employees with the business needs of the organisation.
A standard corporate academy must be able to strategically integrate the [development ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)of individual staff as well as teams into the growth of the organisation.
To achieve a 21st century [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)organisation, the corporate academy must be focused, visionary and company-specific — taking into consideration the organisation’s priorities and adapting its [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)programmes to its corporate strategy.
To successfully institute a corporate academy which is focused on [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)and helps to build and enhance employee skills such as innovation, creativity, leadership, problem solving and practical business knowledge among others, organisations must take the following into consideration:
· Demonstrate the role of the Academy: The drivers of the [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)institute within the organisation must ensure that they adequately educate other members of staff on how the corporate academy will add value to the organisation. This will include the rationale behind the academy, how it will serve as a knowledge centre for employees and a catalyst for organisational growth.
· Align the academy with organisational goals: the academy is not just a place of [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)within the organisation. It is a place of [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)that supports and contributes to the achievement of the strategic goals of the organisation.
· Institute proper oversight: A decision must be taken on whether the corporate academy falls within the purview of HR, the COO, the [learning and development](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/) manager or any other senior manager. What is most important is that a senior member of staff must be saddled with the responsibility of ensuring that the academy plays its role adequately.
· Create a vision: As an organisation, you must have an idea of what your corporate academy will achieve in the next couple of years. Define the short-term goals and long term goals of the academy and develop internal communication to keep staff in the loop regarding its awareness and implementation.
· Determine the operating principles: What are the core values and guiding principles that will determine how you run your academy? These values must align with your organisation’s core values.
In all, a corporate academy must address the business and talent challenges an organisation is faced with. It must also fill the gaps in employee [learning ](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)(Tactical [learning](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)), develop employee skills and capabilities (Integrated [Learning](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)), and combine the elements that affect employee performance (Strategic [Learning](https://workforcegroup.com/learning-and-development/)).
